verses.text: And it shall come to pass after the end of seventy years, that the Lord will visit Tyre, and she shall turn to her hire, and shall commit fornication with all the kingdoms of the world upon the face of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her merchandise and her hire shall be holiness to the Lord: it shall not be treasured nor laid up; for her merchandise shall be for them that dwell before the Lord, to eat sufficiently, and for durable clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the Lord maketh the earth empty, and maketh it waste, and turneth it upside down, and scattereth abroad the inhabitants thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be, as with the people, so with the priest; as with the servant, so with his master; as with the maid, so with her mistress; as with the buyer, so with the seller; as with the lender, so with the borrower; as with the taker of usury, so with the giver of usury to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land shall be utterly emptied, and utterly spoiled: for the Lord hath spoken this word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth mourneth and fadeth away, the world languisheth and fadeth away, the haughty people of the earth do languish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth also is defiled under the inhabitants thereof; because they have transgressed the laws, changed the ordinance, broken the everlasting covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore hath the curse devoured the earth, and they that dwell therein are desolate: therefore the inhabitants of the earth are burned, and few men left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The new wine mourneth, the vine languisheth, all the merryhearted do sigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The mirth of tabrets ceaseth, the noise of them that rejoice endeth, the joy of the harp ceaseth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not drink wine with a song; strong drink shall be bitter to them that drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The city of confusion is broken down: every house is shut up, that no man may come in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a crying for wine in the streets; all joy is darkened, the mirth of the land is gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the city is left desolation, and the gate is smitten with destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When thus it shall be in the midst of the land among the people, there shall be as the shaking of an olive tree, and as the gleaning grapes when the vintage is done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall lift up their voice, they shall sing for the majesty of the Lord, they shall cry aloud from the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore glorify ye the Lord in the fires, even the name of the Lord God of Israel in the isles of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the uttermost part of the earth have we heard songs, even glory to the righteous. But I said, My leanness, my leanness, woe unto me! the treacherous dealers have dealt treacherously; yea, the treacherous dealers have dealt very treacherously.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear, and the pit, and the snare, are upon thee, O inhabitant of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass, that he who fleeth from the noise of the fear shall fall into the pit; and he that cometh up out of the midst of the pit shall be taken in the snare: for the windows from on high are open, and the foundations of the earth do shake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth is utterly broken down, the earth is clean dissolved, the earth is moved exceedingly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth shall reel to and fro like a drunkard, and shall be removed like a cottage; and the transgression thereof shall be heavy upon it; and it shall fall, and not rise again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the Lord shall punish the host of the high ones that are on high, and the kings of the earth upon the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall be gathered together, as prisoners are gathered in the pit, and shall be shut up in the prison, and after many days shall they be visited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the moon shall be confounded, and the sun ashamed, when the Lord of hosts shall reign in mount Zion, and in Jerusalem, and before his ancients gloriously.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, thou art my God; I will exalt thee, I will praise thy name; for thou hast done wonderful things; thy counsels of old are faithfulness and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou hast made of a city an heap; of a defenced city a ruin: a palace of strangers to be no city; it shall never be built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore shall the strong people glorify thee, the city of the terrible nations shall fear thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou hast been a strength to the poor, a strength to the needy in his distress, a refuge from the storm, a shadow from the heat, when the blast of the terrible ones is as a storm against the wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt bring down the noise of strangers, as the heat in a dry place; even the heat with the shadow of a cloud: the branch of the terrible ones shall be brought low.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in this mountain shall the Lord of hosts make unto all people a feast of fat things, a feast of wines on the lees, of fat things full of marrow, of wines on the lees well refined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will destroy in this mountain the face of the covering cast over all people, and the vail that is spread over all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will swallow up death in victory; and the Lord God will wipe away tears from off all faces; and the rebuke of his people shall he take away from off all the earth: for the Lord hath spoken it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be said in that day, Lo, this is our God; we have waited for him, and he will save us: this is the Lord; we have waited for him, we will be glad and rejoice in his salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in this mountain shall the hand of the Lord rest, and Moab shall be trodden down under him, even as straw is trodden down for the dunghill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall spread forth his hands in the midst of them, as he that swimmeth spreadeth forth his hands to swim: and he shall bring down their pride together with the spoils of their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the fortress of the high fort of thy walls shall he bring down, lay low, and bring to the ground, even to the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day shall this song be sung in the land of Judah; We have a strong city; salvation will God appoint for walls and bulwarks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Open ye the gates, that the righteous nation which keepeth the truth may enter in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusteth in thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Trust ye in the Lord for ever: for in the Lord Jehovah is everlasting strength:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he bringeth down them that dwell on high; the lofty city, he layeth it low; he layeth it low, even to the ground; he bringeth it even to the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The foot shall tread it down, even the feet of the poor, and the steps of the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of the just is uprightness: thou, most upright, dost weigh the path of the just.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, in the way of thy judgments, O Lord, have we waited for thee; the desire of our soul is to thy name, and to the remembrance of thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With my soul have I desired thee in the night; yea, with my spirit within me will I seek thee early: for when thy judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let favour be shewed to the wicked, yet will he not learn righteousness: in the land of uprightness will he deal unjustly, and will not behold the majesty of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, when thy hand is lifted up, they will not see: but they shall see, and be ashamed for their envy at the people; yea, the fire of thine enemies shall devour them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, thou wilt ordain peace for us: for thou also hast wrought all our works in us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord our God, other lords beside thee have had dominion over us: but by thee only will we make mention of thy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are dead, they shall not live; they are deceased, they shall not rise: therefore hast thou visited and destroyed them, and made all their memory to perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast increased the nation, O Lord, thou hast increased the nation: thou art glorified: thou hadst removed it far unto all the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, in trouble have they visited thee, they poured out a prayer when thy chastening was upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like as a woman with child, that draweth near the time of her delivery, is in pain, and crieth out in her pangs; so have we been in thy sight, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have been with child, we have been in pain, we have as it were brought forth wind; we have not wrought any deliverance in the earth; neither have the inhabitants of the world fallen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy dead men shall live, together with my dead body shall they arise. Awake and sing, ye that dwell in dust: for thy dew is as the dew of herbs, and the earth shall cast out the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come, my people, enter thou into thy chambers, and shut thy doors about thee: hide thyself as it were for a little moment, until the indignation be overpast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, behold, the Lord cometh out of his place to punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity: the earth also shall disclose her blood, and shall no more cover her slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day the Lord with his sore and great and strong sword shall punish leviathan the piercing serpent, even leviathan that crooked serpent; and he shall slay the dragon that is in the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day sing ye unto her, A vineyard of red wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I the Lord do keep it; I will water it every moment: lest any hurt it, I will keep it night and day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fury is not in me: who would set the briers and thorns against me in battle? I would go through them, I would burn them together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or let him take hold of my strength, that he may make peace with me; and he shall make peace with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall cause them that come of Jacob to take root: Israel shall blossom and bud, and fill the face of the world with fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hath he smitten him, as he smote those that smote him? or is he slain according to the slaughter of them that are slain by him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In measure, when it shooteth forth, thou wilt debate with it: he stayeth his rough wind in the day of the east wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By this therefore shall the iniquity of Jacob be purged; and this is all the fruit to take away his sin; when he maketh all the stones of the altar as chalkstones that are beaten in sunder, the groves and images shall not stand up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the defenced city shall be desolate, and the habitation forsaken, and left like a wilderness: there shall the calf feed, and there shall he lie down, and consume the branches thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the boughs thereof are withered, they shall be broken off: the women come, and set them on fire: for it is a people of no understanding: therefore he that made them will not have mercy on them, and he that formed them will shew them no favour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the Lord shall beat off from the channel of the river unto the stream of Egypt, and ye shall be gathered one by one, O ye children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the great trumpet shall be blown, and they shall come which were ready to perish in the land of Assyria, and the outcasts in the land of Egypt, and shall worship the Lord in the holy mount at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to the crown of pride, to the drunkards of Ephraim, whose glorious beauty is a fading flower, which are on the head of the fat valleys of them that are overcome with wine!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the Lord hath a mighty and strong one, which as a tempest of hail and a destroying storm, as a flood of mighty waters overflowing, shall cast down to the earth with the hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crown of pride, the drunkards of Ephraim, shall be trodden under feet:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fat valley, shall be a fading flower, and as the hasty fruit before the summer; which when he that looketh upon it seeth, while it is yet in his hand he eateth it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day shall the Lord of hosts be for a crown of glory, and for a diadem of beauty, unto the residue of his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for a spirit of judgment to him that sitteth in judgment, and for strength to them that turn the battle to the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they also have erred through wine, and through strong drink are out of the way; the priest and the prophet have erred through strong drink, they are swallowed up of wine, they are out of the way through strong drink; they err in vision, they stumble in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all tables are full of vomit and filthiness, so that there is no place clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whom shall he teach knowledge? and whom shall he make to understand doctrine? them that are weaned from the milk, and drawn from the breasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For precept must be upon precept, precept upon precept; line upon line, line upon line; here a little, and there a little:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For with stammering lips and another tongue will he speak to this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom he said, This is the rest wherewith ye may cause the weary to rest; and this is the refreshing: yet they would not hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the word of the Lord was unto them precept upon precept, precept upon precept; line upon line, line upon line; here a little, and there a little; that they might go, and fall backward, and be broken, and snared, and taken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore hear the word of the Lord, ye scornful men, that rule this people which is in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because ye have said, We have made a covenant with death, and with hell are we at agreement; when the overflowing scourge shall pass through, it shall not come unto us: for we have made lies our refuge, and under falsehood have we hid ourselves:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus saith the Lord God, Behold, I lay in Zion for a foundation a stone, a tried stone, a precious corner stone, a sure foundation: he that believeth shall not make haste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judgment also will I lay to the line, and righteousness to the plummet: and the hail shall sweep away the refuge of lies, and the waters shall overflow the hiding place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And your covenant with death shall be disannulled, and your agreement with hell shall not stand; when the overflowing scourge shall pass through, then ye shall be trodden down by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the time that it goeth forth it shall take you: for morning by morning shall it pass over, by day and by night: and it shall be a vexation only to understand the report.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the bed is shorter than that a man can stretch himself on it: and the covering narrower than that he can wrap himself in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord shall rise up as in mount Perazim, he shall be wroth as in the valley of Gibeon, that he may do his work, his strange work; and bring to pass his act, his strange act.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore be ye not mockers, lest your bands be made strong: for I have heard from the Lord God of hosts a consumption, even determined upon the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Doth the plowman plow all day to sow? doth he open and break the clods of his ground?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he hath made plain the face thereof, doth he not cast abroad the fitches, and scatter the cummin, and cast in the principal wheat and the appointed barley and the rie in their place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For his God doth instruct him to discretion, and doth teach him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the fitches are not threshed with a threshing instrument, neither is a cart wheel turned about upon the cummin; but the fitches are beaten out with a staff, and the cummin with a rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bread corn is bruised; because he will not ever be threshing it, nor break it with the wheel of his cart, nor bruise it with his horsemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This also cometh forth from the Lord of hosts, which is wonderful in counsel, and excellent in working.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to Ariel, to Ariel, the city where David dwelt! add ye year to year; let them kill sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet I will distress Ariel, and there shall be heaviness and sorrow: and it shall be unto me as Ariel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will camp against thee round about, and will lay siege against thee with a mount, and I will raise forts against thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt be brought down, and shalt speak out of the ground, and thy speech shall be low out of the dust, and thy voice shall be, as of one that hath a familiar spirit, out of the ground, and thy speech shall whisper out of the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover the multitude of thy strangers shall be like small dust, and the multitude of the terrible ones shall be as chaff that passeth away: yea, it shall be at an instant suddenly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt be visited of the Lord of hosts with thunder, and with earthquake, and great noise, with storm and tempest, and the flame of devouring fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the multitude of all the nations that fight against Ariel, even all that fight against her and her munition, and that distress her, shall be as a dream of a night vision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall even be as when an hungry man dreameth, and, behold, he eateth; but he awaketh, and his soul is empty: or as when a thirsty man dreameth, and, behold, he drinketh; but he awaketh, and, behold, he is faint, and his soul hath appetite: so shall the multitude of all the nations be, that fight against mount Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stay yourselves, and wonder; cry ye out, and cry: they are drunken, but not with wine; they stagger, but not with strong drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord hath poured out upon you the spirit of deep sleep, and hath closed your eyes: the prophets and your rulers, the seers hath he covered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the vision of all is become unto you as the words of a book that is sealed, which men deliver to one that is learned, saying, Read this, I pray thee: and he saith, I cannot; for it is sealed:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the book is delivered to him that is not learned, saying, Read this, I pray thee: and he saith, I am not learned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore the Lord said, Forasmuch as this people draw near me with their mouth, and with their lips do honour me, but have removed their heart far from me, and their fear toward me is taught by the precept of men:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, behold, I will proceed to do a marvellous work among this people, even a marvellous work and a wonder: for the wisdom of their wise men shall perish, and the understanding of their prudent men shall be hid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe unto them that seek deep to hide their counsel from the Lord, and their works are in the dark, and they say, Who seeth us? and who knoweth us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely your turning of things upside down shall be esteemed as the potterâ€™s clay: for shall the work say of him that made it, He made me not? or shall the thing framed say of him that framed it, He had no understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it not yet a very little while, and Lebanon shall be turned into a fruitful field, and the fruitful field shall be esteemed as a forest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in that day shall the deaf hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity, and out of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The meek also shall increase their joy in the Lord, and the poor among men shall rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the terrible one is brought to nought, and the scorner is consumed, and all that watch for iniquity are cut off:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That make a man an offender for a word, and lay a snare for him that reproveth in the gate, and turn aside the just for a thing of nought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus saith the Lord, who redeemed Abraham, concerning the house of Jacob, Jacob shall not now be ashamed, neither shall his face now wax pale.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he seeth his children, the work of mine hands, in the midst of him, they shall sanctify my name, and sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and shall fear the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also that erred in spirit shall come to understanding, and they that murmured shall learn doctrine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to the rebellious children, saith the Lord, that take counsel, but not of me; and that cover with a covering, but not of my Spirit, that they may add sin to sin:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That walk to go down into Egypt, and have not asked at my mouth; to strengthen themselves in the strength of Pharaoh, and to trust in the shadow of Egypt!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore shall the strength of Pharaoh be your shame, and the trust in the shadow of Egypt your confusion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For his princes were at Zoan, and his ambassadors came to Hanes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were all ashamed of a people that could not profit them, nor be an help nor profit, but a shame, and also a reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The burden of the beasts of the south: into the land of trouble and anguish, from whence come the young and old lion, the viper and fiery flying serpent, they will carry their riches upon the shoulders of young asses, and their treasures upon the bunches of camels, to a people that shall not profit them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Egyptians shall help in vain, and to no purpose: therefore have I cried concerning this, Their strength is to sit still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now go, write it before them in a table, and note it in a book, that it may be for the time to come for ever and ever:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That this is a rebellious people, lying children, children that will not hear the law of the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which say to the seers, See not; and to the prophets, Prophesy not unto us right things, speak unto us smooth things, prophesy deceits:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get you out of the way, turn aside out of the path, cause the Holy One of Israel to cease from before us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore thus saith the Holy One of Israel, Because ye despise this word, and trust in oppression and perverseness, and stay thereon:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore this iniquity shall be to you as a breach ready to fall, swelling out in a high wall, whose breaking cometh suddenly at an instant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall break it as the breaking of the pottersâ€™ vessel that is broken in pieces; he shall not spare: so that there shall not be found in the bursting of it a sherd to take fire from the hearth, or to take water withal out of the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus saith the Lord God, the Holy One of Israel; In returning and rest shall ye be saved; in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength: and ye would not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye said, No; for we will flee upon horses; therefore shall ye flee: and, We will ride upon the swift; therefore shall they that pursue you be swift.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One thousand shall flee at the rebuke of one; at the rebuke of five shall ye flee: till ye be left as a beacon upon the top of a mountain, and as an ensign on an hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And therefore will the Lord wait, that he may be gracious unto you, and therefore will he be exalted, that he may have mercy upon you: for the Lord is a God of judgment: blessed are all they that wait for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the people shall dwell in Zion at Jerusalem: thou shalt weep no more: he will be very gracious unto thee at the voice of thy cry; when he shall hear it, he will answer thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And though the Lord give you the bread of adversity, and the water of affliction, yet shall not thy teachers be removed into a corner any more, but thine eyes shall see thy teachers:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thine ears shall hear a word behind thee, saying, This is the way, walk ye in it, when ye turn to the right hand, and when ye turn to the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall defile also the covering of thy graven images of silver, and the ornament of thy molten images of gold: thou shalt cast them away as a menstruous cloth; thou shalt say unto it, Get thee hence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall he give the rain of thy seed, that thou shalt sow the ground withal; and bread of the increase of the earth, and it shall be fat and plenteous: in that day shall thy cattle feed in large pastures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The oxen likewise and the young asses that ear the ground shall eat clean provender, which hath been winnowed with the shovel and with the fan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there shall be upon every high mountain, and upon every high hill, rivers and streams of waters in the day of the great slaughter, when the towers fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover the light of the moon shall be as the light of the sun, and the light of the sun shall be sevenfold, as the light of seven days, in the day that the Lord bindeth up the breach of his people, and healeth the stroke of their wound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the name of the Lord cometh from far, burning with his anger, and the burden thereof is heavy: his lips are full of indignation, and his tongue as a devouring fire:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his breath, as an overflowing stream, shall reach to the midst of the neck, to sift the nations with the sieve of vanity: and there shall be a bridle in the jaws of the people, causing them to err.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall have a song, as in the night when a holy solemnity is kept; and gladness of heart, as when one goeth with a pipe to come into the mountain of the Lord, to the mighty One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord shall cause his glorious voice to be heard, and shall shew the lighting down of his arm, with the indignation of his anger, and with the flame of a devouring fire, with scattering, and tempest, and hailstones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For through the voice of the Lord shall the Assyrian be beaten down, which smote with a rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in every place where the grounded staff shall pass, which the Lord shall lay upon him, it shall be with tabrets and harps: and in battles of shaking will he fight with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Tophet is ordained of old; yea, for the king it is prepared; he hath made it deep and large: the pile thereof is fire and much wood; the breath of the Lord, like a stream of brimstone, doth kindle it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to them that go down to Egypt for help; and stay on horses, and trust in chariots, because they are many; and in horsemen, because they are very strong; but they look not unto the Holy One of Israel, neither seek the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet he also is wise, and will bring evil, and will not call back his words: but will arise against the house of the evildoers, and against the help of them that work iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Egyptians are men, and not God; and their horses flesh, and not spirit. When the Lord shall stretch out his hand, both he that helpeth shall fall, and he that is holpen shall fall down, and they all shall fail together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus hath the Lord spoken unto me, Like as the lion and the young lion roaring on his prey, when a multitude of shepherds is called forth against him, he will not be afraid of their voice, nor abase himself for the noise of them: so shall the Lord of hosts come down to fight for mount Zion, and for the hill thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As birds flying, so will the Lord of hosts defend Jerusalem; defending also he will deliver it; and passing over he will preserve it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Turn ye unto him from whom the children of Israel have deeply revolted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in that day every man shall cast away his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which your own hands have made unto you for a sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall the Assyrian fall with the sword, not of a mighty man; and the sword, not of a mean man, shall devour him: but he shall flee from the sword, and his young men shall be discomfited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall pass over to his strong hold for fear, and his princes shall be afraid of the ensign, saith the Lord, whose fire is in Zion, and his furnace in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a king shall reign in righteousness, and princes shall rule in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a man shall be as an hiding place from the wind, and a covert from the tempest; as rivers of water in a dry place, as the shadow of a great rock in a weary land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the eyes of them that see shall not be dim, and the ears of them that hear shall hearken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heart also of the rash shall understand knowledge, and the tongue of the stammerers shall be ready to speak plainly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The vile person shall be no more called liberal, nor the churl said to be bountiful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the vile person will speak villany, and his heart will work iniquity, to practise hypocrisy, and to utter error against the Lord, to make empty the soul of the hungry, and he will cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The instruments also of the churl are evil: he deviseth wicked devices to destroy the poor with lying words, even when the needy speaketh right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the liberal deviseth liberal things; and by liberal things shall he stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rise up, ye women that are at ease; hear my voice, ye careless daughters; give ear unto my speech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many days and years shall ye be troubled, ye careless women: for the vintage shall fail, the gathering shall not come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tremble, ye women that are at ease; be troubled, ye careless ones: strip you, and make you bare, and gird sackcloth upon your loins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall lament for the teats, for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Upon the land of my people shall come up thorns and briers; yea, upon all the houses of joy in the joyous city:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the palaces shall be forsaken; the multitude of the city shall be left; the forts and towers shall be for dens for ever, a joy of wild asses, a pasture of flocks;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Until the Spirit be poured upon us from on high, and the wilderness be a fruitful field, and the fruitful field be counted for a forest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then judgment shall dwell in the wilderness, and righteousness remain in the fruitful field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the work of righteousness shall be peace; and the effect of righteousness quietness and assurance for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And my people shall dwell in a peaceable habitation, and in sure dwellings, and in quiet resting places;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it shall hail, coming down on the forest; and the city shall be low in a low place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are ye that sow beside all waters, that send forth thither the feet of the ox and the ass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to thee that spoilest, and thou wast not spoiled; and dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee! when thou shalt cease to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled; and when thou shalt make an end to deal treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, be gracious unto us; we have waited for thee: be thou their arm every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the noise of the tumult the people fled; at the lifting up of thyself the nations were scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And your spoil shall be gathered like the gathering of the caterpiller: as the running to and fro of locusts shall he run upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is exalted; for he dwelleth on high: he hath filled Zion with judgment and righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And wisdom and knowledge shall be the stability of thy times, and strength of salvation: the fear of the Lord is his treasure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, their valiant ones shall cry without: the ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The highways lie waste, the wayfaring man ceaseth: he hath broken the covenant, he hath despised the cities, he regardeth no man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth mourneth and languisheth: Lebanon is ashamed and hewn down: Sharon is like a wilderness; and Bashan and Carmel shake off their fruits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now will I rise, saith the Lord; now will I be exalted; now will I lift up myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: your breath, as fire, shall devour you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people shall be as the burnings of lime: as thorns cut up shall they be burned in the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear, ye that are far off, what I have done; and, ye that are near, acknowledge my might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness hath surprised the hypocrites. Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of oppressions, that shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, that stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and shutteth his eyes from seeing evil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall dwell on high: his place of defence shall be the munitions of rocks: bread shall be given him; his waters shall be sure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thine eyes shall see the king in his beauty: they shall behold the land that is very far off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thine heart shall meditate terror. Where is the scribe? where is the receiver? where is he that counted the towers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt not see a fierce people, a people of a deeper speech than thou canst perceive; of a stammering tongue, that thou canst not understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look upon Zion, the city of our solemnities: thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacle that shall not be taken down; not one of the stakes thereof shall ever be removed, neither shall any of the cords thereof be broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there the glorious Lord will be unto us a place of broad rivers and streams; wherein shall go no galley with oars, neither shall gallant ship pass thereby.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord is our judge, the Lord is our lawgiver, the Lord is our king; he will save us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy tacklings are loosed; they could not well strengthen their mast, they could not spread the sail: then is the prey of a great spoil divided; the lame take the prey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come near, ye nations, to hear; and hearken, ye people: let the earth hear, and all that is therein; the world, and all things that come forth of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the indignation of the Lord is upon all nations, and his fury upon all their armies: he hath utterly destroyed them, he hath delivered them to the slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their slain also shall be cast out, and their stink shall come up out of their carcases, and the mountains shall be melted with their blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the host of heaven shall be dissolved, and the heavens shall be rolled together as a scroll: and all their host shall fall down, as the leaf falleth off from the vine, and as a falling fig from the fig tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my sword shall be bathed in heaven: behold, it shall come down upon Idumea, and upon the people of my curse, to judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sword of the Lord is filled with blood, it is made fat with fatness, and with the blood of lambs and goats, with the fat of the kidneys of rams: for the Lord hath a sacrifice in Bozrah, and a great slaughter in the land of Idumea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the unicorns shall come down with them, and the bullocks with the bulls; and their land shall be soaked with blood, and their dust made fat with fatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is the day of the Lordâ€™S vengeance, and the year of recompences for the controversy of Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the streams thereof shall be turned into pitch, and the dust thereof into brimstone, and the land thereof shall become burning pitch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall not be quenched night nor day; the smoke thereof shall go up for ever: from generation to generation it shall lie waste; none shall pass through it for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the cormorant and the bittern shall possess it; the owl also and the raven shall dwell in it: and he shall stretch out upon it the line of confusion, and the stones of emptiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall call the nobles thereof to the kingdom, but none shall be there, and all her princes shall be nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thorns shall come up in her palaces, nettles and brambles in the fortresses thereof: and it shall be an habitation of dragons, and a court for owls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wild beasts of the desert shall also meet with the wild beasts of the island, and the satyr shall cry to his fellow; the screech owl also shall rest there, and find for herself a place of rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall the great owl make her nest, and lay, and hatch, and gather under her shadow: there shall the vultures also be gathered, every one with her mate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seek ye out of the book of the Lord, and read: no one of these shall fail, none shall want her mate: for my mouth it hath commanded, and his Spirit it hath gathered them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he hath cast the lot for them, and his hand hath divided it unto them by line: they shall possess it for ever, from generation to generation shall they dwell therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wilderness and the solitary place shall be glad for them; and the desert shall rejoice, and blossom as the rose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall blossom abundantly, and rejoice even with joy and singing: the glory of Lebanon shall be given unto it, the excellency of Carmel and Sharon, they shall see the glory of the Lord, and the excellency of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Strengthen ye the weak hands, and confirm the feeble knees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them that are of a fearful heart, Be strong, fear not: behold, your God will come with vengeance, even God with a recompence; he will come and save you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall the lame man leap as an hart, and the tongue of the dumb sing: for in the wilderness shall waters break out, and streams in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the parched ground shall become a pool, and the thirsty land springs of water: in the habitation of dragons, where each lay, shall be grass with reeds and rushes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an highway shall be there, and a way, and it shall be called The way of holiness; the unclean shall not pass over it; but it shall be for those: the wayfaring men, though fools, shall not err therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No lion shall be there, nor any ravenous beast shall go up thereon, it shall not be found there; but the redeemed shall walk there:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the ransomed of the Lord shall return, and come to Zion with songs and everlasting joy upon their heads: they shall obtain joy and gladness, and sorrow and sighing shall flee away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah, that Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all the defenced cities of Judah, and took them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king of Assyria sent Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem unto king Hezekiah with a great army. And he stood by the conduit of the upper pool in the highway of the fullerâ€™s field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came forth unto him Eliakim, Hilkiahâ€™s son, which was over the house, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, Asaphâ€™s son, the recorder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Rabshakeh said unto them, Say ye now to Hezekiah, Thus saith the great king, the king of Assyria, What confidence is this wherein thou trustest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say, sayest thou, (but they are but vain words) I have counsel and strength for war: now on whom dost thou trust, that thou rebellest against me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lo, thou trustest in the staff of this broken reed, on Egypt; whereon if a man lean, it will go into his hand, and pierce it: so is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all that trust in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if thou say to me, We trust in the Lord our God: is it not he, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath taken away, and said to Judah and to Jerusalem, Ye shall worship before this altar?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore give pledges, I pray thee, to my master the king of Assyria, and I will give thee two thousand horses, if thou be able on thy part to set riders upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How then wilt thou turn away the face of one captain of the least of my masterâ€™s servants, and put thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And am I now come up without the Lord against this land to destroy it? the Lord said unto me, Go up against this land, and destroy it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Eliakim and Shebna and Joah unto Rabshakeh, Speak, I pray thee, unto thy servants in the Syrian language; for we understand it: and speak not to us in the Jewsâ€™ language, in the ears of the people that are on the wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Rabshakeh said, Hath my master sent me to thy master and to thee to speak these words? hath he not sent me to the men that sit upon the wall, that they may eat their own dung, and drink their own piss with you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rabshakeh stood, and cried with a loud voice in the Jewsâ€™ language, and said, Hear ye the words of the great king, the king of Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the king, Let not Hezekiah deceive you: for he shall not be able to deliver you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither let Hezekiah make you trust in the Lord, saying, The Lord will surely deliver us: this city shall not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hearken not to Hezekiah: for thus saith the king of Assyria, Make an agreement with me by a present, and come out to me: and eat ye every one of his vine, and every one of his fig tree, and drink ye every one the waters of his own cistern;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of corn and wine, a land of bread and vineyards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware lest Hezekiah persuade you, saying, The Lord will deliver us. Hath any of the gods of the nations delivered his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arphad? where are the gods of Sepharvaim? and have they delivered Samaria out of my hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who are they among all the gods of these lands, that have delivered their land out of my hand, that the Lord should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they held their peace, and answered him not a word: for the kingâ€™s commandment was, saying, Answer him not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came Eliakim, the son of Hilkiah, that was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, the son of Asaph, the recorder, to Hezekiah with their clothes rent, and told him the words of Rabshakeh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when king Hezekiah heard it, that he rent his clothes, and covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent Eliakim, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests covered with sackcloth, unto Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto him, Thus saith Hezekiah, This day is a day of trouble, and of rebuke, and of blasphemy: for the children are come to the birth, and there is not strength to bring forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It may be the Lord thy God will hear the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master hath sent to reproach the living God, and will reprove the words which the Lord thy God hath heard: wherefore lift up thy prayer for the remnant that is left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaiah said unto them, Thus shall ye say unto your master, Thus saith the Lord, Be not afraid of the words that thou hast heard, wherewith the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will send a blast upon him, and he shall hear a rumour, and return to his own land; and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah: for he had heard that he was departed from Lachish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he heard say concerning Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, He is come forth to make war with thee. And when he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus shall ye speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, Let not thy God, in whom thou trustest, deceive thee, saying, Jerusalem shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, thou hast heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands by destroying them utterly; and shalt thou be delivered?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have the gods of the nations delivered them which my fathers have destroyed, as Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and the children of Eden which were in Telassar?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where is the king of Hamath, and the king of Arphad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivah?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hezekiah received the letter from the hand of the messengers, and read it: and Hezekiah went up unto the house of the Lord, and spread it before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hezekiah prayed unto the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord of hosts, God of Israel, that dwellest between the cherubims, thou art the God, even thou alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth: thou hast made heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Incline thine ear, O Lord, and hear; open thine eyes, O Lord, and see: and hear all the words of Sennacherib, which hath sent to reproach the living God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of a truth, Lord, the kings of Assyria have laid waste all the nations, and their countries,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And have cast their gods into the fire: for they were no gods, but the work of menâ€™s hands, wood and stone: therefore they have destroyed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, O Lord our God, save us from his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that thou art the Lord, even thou only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent unto Hezekiah, saying, Thus saith the Lord God of Israel, Whereas thou hast prayed to me against Sennacherib king of Assyria:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word which the Lord hath spoken concerning him; The virgin, the daughter of Zion, hath despised thee, and laughed thee to scorn; the daughter of Jerusalem hath shaken her head at thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whom hast thou reproached and blasphemed? and against whom hast thou exalted thy voice, and lifted up thine eyes on high? even against the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By thy servants hast thou reproached the Lord, and hast said, By the multitude of my chariots am I come up to the height of the mountains, to the sides of Lebanon; and I will cut down the tall cedars thereof, and the choice fir trees thereof: and I will enter into the height of his border, and the forest of his Carmel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have digged, and drunk water; and with the sole of my feet have I dried up all the rivers of the besieged places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou not heard long ago, how I have done it; and of ancient times, that I have formed it? now have I brought it to pass, that thou shouldest be to lay waste defenced cities into ruinous heaps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore their inhabitants were of small power, they were dismayed and confounded: they were as the grass of the field, and as the green herb, as the grass on the housetops, and as corn blasted before it be grown up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I know thy abode, and thy going out, and thy coming in, and thy rage against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because thy rage against me, and thy tumult, is come up into mine ears, therefore will I put my hook in thy nose, and my bridle in thy lips, and I will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this shall be a sign unto thee, Ye shall eat this year such as groweth of itself; and the second year that which springeth of the same: and in the third year sow ye, and reap, and plant vineyards, and eat the fruit thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah shall again take root downward, and bear fruit upward:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant, and they that escape out of mount Zion: the zeal of the Lord of hosts shall do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus saith the Lord concerning the king of Assyria, He shall not come into this city, nor shoot an arrow there, nor come before it with shields, nor cast a bank against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the way that he came, by the same shall he return, and shall not come into this city, saith the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will defend this city to save it for mine own sake, and for my servant Davidâ€™s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the Lord went forth, and smote in the camp of the Assyrians a hundred and fourscore and five thousand: and when they arose early in the morning, behold, they were all dead corpses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed, and went and returned, and dwelt at Nineveh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons smote him with the sword; and they escaped into the land of Armenia: and Esar-haddon his son reigned in his stead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz came unto him, and said unto him, Thus saith the Lord, Set thine house in order: for thou shalt die, and not live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall, and prayed unto the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said, Remember now, O Lord, I beseech thee, how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept sore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the word of the Lord to Isaiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go, and say to Hezekiah, Thus saith the Lord, the God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears: behold, I will add unto thy days fifteen years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria: and I will defend this city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this shall be a sign unto thee from the Lord, that the Lord will do this thing that he hath spoken;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will bring again the shadow of the degrees, which is gone down in the sun dial of Ahaz, ten degrees backward. So the sun returned ten degrees, by which degrees it was gone down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick, and was recovered of his sickness:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said in the cutting off of my days, I shall go to the gates of the grave: I am deprived of the residue of my years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said, I shall not see the Lord, even the Lord, in the land of the living: I shall behold man no more with the inhabitants of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mine age is departed, and is removed from me as a shepherdâ€™s tent: I have cut off like a weaver my life: he will cut me off with pining sickness: from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I reckoned till morning, that, as a lion, so will he break all my bones: from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like a crane or a swallow, so did I chatter: I did mourn as a dove: mine eyes fail with looking upward: O Lord, I am oppressed; undertake for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What shall I say? he hath both spoken unto me, and himself hath done it: I shall go softly all my years in the bitterness of my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, by these things men live, and in all these things is the life of my spirit: so wilt thou recover me, and make me to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, for peace I had great bitterness: but thou hast in love to my soul delivered it from the pit of corruption: for thou hast cast all my sins behind thy back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the grave cannot praise thee, death can not celebrate thee: they that go down into the pit cannot hope for thy truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The living, the living, he shall praise thee, as I do this day: the father to the children shall make known thy truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord was ready to save me: therefore we will sing my songs to the stringed instruments all the days of our life in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Isaiah had said, Let them take a lump of figs, and lay it for a plaister upon the boil, and he shall recover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hezekiah also had said, What is the sign that I shall go up to the house of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Merodach-baladan, the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah: for he had heard that he had been sick, and was recovered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hezekiah was glad of them, and shewed them the house of his precious things, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the precious ointment, and all the house of his armour, and all that was found in his treasures: there was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah shewed them not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came Isaiah the prophet unto king Hezekiah, and said unto him, What said these men? and from whence came they unto thee? And Hezekiah said, They are come from a far country unto me, even from Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he, What have they seen in thine house? And Hezekiah answered, All that is in mine house have they seen: there is nothing among my treasures that I have not shewed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Isaiah to Hezekiah, Hear the word of the Lord of hosts:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the days come, that all that is in thine house, and that which thy fathers have laid up in store until this day, shall be carried to Babylon: nothing shall be left, saith the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of thy sons that shall issue from thee, which thou shalt beget, shall they take away; and they shall be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Hezekiah to Isaiah, Good is the word of the Lord which thou hast spoken. He said moreover, For there shall be peace and truth in my days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Comfort ye, comfort ye my people, saith your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak ye comfortably to Jerusalem, and cry unto her, that her warfare is accomplished, that her iniquity is pardoned: for she hath received of the Lordâ€™S hand double for all her sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The voice of him that crieth in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make straight in the desert a highway for our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every valley shall be exalted, and every mountain and hill shall be made low: and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough places plain:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the glory of the Lord shall be revealed, and all flesh shall see it together: for the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The voice said, Cry. And he said, What shall I cry? All flesh is grass, and all the goodliness thereof is as the flower of the field:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: because the Spirit of the Lord bloweth upon it: surely the people is grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: but the word of our God shall stand for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Zion, that bringest good tidings, get thee up into the high mountain; O Jerusalem, that bringest good tidings, lift up thy voice with strength; lift it up, be not afraid; say unto the cities of Judah, Behold your God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the Lord God will come with strong hand, and his arm shall rule for him: behold, his reward is with him, and his work before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall feed his flock like a shepherd: he shall gather the lambs with his arm, and carry them in his bosom, and shall gently lead those that are with young.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who hath measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, and meted out heaven with the span, and comprehended the dust of the earth in a measure, and weighed the mountains in scales, and the hills in a balance?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who hath directed the Spirit of the Lord, or being his counsellor hath taught him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With whom took he counsel, and who instructed him, and taught him in the path of judgment, and taught him knowledge, and shewed to him the way of understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the nations are as a drop of a bucket, and are counted as the small dust of the balance: behold, he taketh up the isles as a very little thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Lebanon is not sufficient to burn, nor the beasts thereof sufficient for a burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All nations before him are as nothing; and they are counted to him less than nothing, and vanity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom then will ye liken God? or what likeness will ye compare unto him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The workman melteth a graven image, and the goldsmith spreadeth it over with gold, and casteth silver chains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is so impoverished that he hath no oblation chooseth a tree that will not rot; he seeketh unto him a cunning workman to prepare a graven image, that shall not be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have ye not known? have ye not heard? hath it not been told you from the beginning? have ye not understood from the foundations of the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is he that sitteth upon the circle of the earth, and the inhabitants thereof are as grasshoppers; that stretcheth out the heavens as a curtain, and spreadeth them out as a tent to dwell in:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That bringeth the princes to nothing; he maketh the judges of the earth as vanity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, they shall not be planted; yea, they shall not be sown: yea, their stock shall not take root in the earth: and he shall also blow upon them, and they shall wither, and the whirlwind shall take them away as stubble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom then will ye liken me, or shall I be equal? saith the Holy One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lift up your eyes on high, and behold who hath created these things, that bringeth out their host by number: he calleth them all by names by the greatness of his might, for that he is strong in power; not one faileth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why sayest thou, O Jacob, and speakest, O Israel, My way is hid from the Lord, and my judgment is passed over from my God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast thou not known? hast thou not heard, that the everlasting God, the Lord, the Creator of the ends of the earth, fainteth not, neither is weary? there is no searching of his understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He giveth power to the faint; and to them that have no might he increaseth strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even the youths shall faint and be weary, and the young men shall utterly fall:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep silence before me, O islands; and let the people renew their strength: let them come near; then let them speak: let us come near together to judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who raised up the righteous man from the east, called him to his foot, gave the nations before him, and made him rule over kings? he gave them as the dust to his sword, and as driven stubble to his bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He pursued them, and passed safely; even by the way that he had not gone with his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who hath wrought and done it, calling the generations from the beginning? I the Lord, the first, and with the last; I am he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The isles saw it, and feared; the ends of the earth were afraid, drew near, and came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They helped every one his neighbour; and every one said to his brother, Be of good courage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the carpenter encouraged the goldsmith, and he that smootheth with the hammer him that smote the anvil, saying, It is ready for the sodering: and he fastened it with nails, that it should not be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thou, Israel, art my servant, Jacob whom I have chosen, the seed of Abraham my friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou whom I have taken from the ends of the earth, and called thee from the chief men thereof, and said unto thee, Thou art my servant; I have chosen thee, and not cast thee away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, all they that were incensed against thee shall be ashamed and confounded: they shall be as nothing; and they that strive with thee shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt seek them, and shalt not find them, even them that contended with thee: they that war against thee shall be as nothing, and as a thing of nought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I the Lord thy God will hold thy right hand, saying unto thee, Fear not; I will help thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear not, thou worm Jacob, and ye men of Israel; I will help thee, saith the Lord, and thy redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will make thee a new sharp threshing instrument having teeth: thou shalt thresh the mountains, and beat them small, and shalt make the hills as chaff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt fan them, and the wind shall carry them away, and the whirlwind shall scatter them: and thou shalt rejoice in the Lord, and shalt glory in the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the poor and needy seek water, and there is none, and their tongue faileth for thirst, I the Lord will hear them, I the God of Israel will not forsake them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will open rivers in high places, and fountains in the midst of the valleys: I will make the wilderness a pool of water, and the dry land springs of water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will plant in the wilderness the cedar, the shittah tree, and the myrtle, and the oil tree; I will set in the desert the fir tree, and the pine, and the box tree together:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That they may see, and know, and consider, and understand together, that the hand of the Lord hath done this, and the Holy One of Israel hath created it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Produce your cause, saith the Lord; bring forth your strong reasons, saith the King of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them bring them forth, and shew us what shall happen: let them shew the former things, what they be, that we may consider them, and know the latter end of them; or declare us things for to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shew the things that are to come hereafter, that we may know that ye are gods: yea, do good, or do evil, that we may be dismayed, and behold it together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, ye are of nothing, and your work of nought: an abomination is he that chooseth you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have raised up one from the north, and he shall come: from the rising of the sun shall he call upon my name: and he shall come upon princes as upon morter, and as the potter treadeth clay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who hath declared from the beginning, that we may know? and beforetime, that we may say, He is righteous? yea, there is none that sheweth, yea, there is none that declareth, yea, there is none that heareth your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first shall say to Zion, Behold, behold them: and I will give to Jerusalem one that bringeth good tidings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I beheld, and there was no man; even among them, and there was no counsellor, that, when I asked of them, could answer a word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, they are all vanity; their works are nothing: their molten images are wind and confusion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold my servant, whom I uphold; mine elect, in whom my soul delighteth; I have put my Spirit upon him: he shall bring forth judgment to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not cry, nor lift up, nor cause his voice to be heard in the street.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A bruised reed shall he not break, and the smoking flax shall he not quench: he shall bring forth judgment unto truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not fail nor be discouraged, till he have set judgment in the earth: and the isles shall wait for his law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith God the Lord, he that created the heavens, and stretched them out; he that spread forth the earth, and that which cometh out of it; he that giveth breath unto the people upon it, and spirit to them that walk therein:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I the Lord have called thee in righteousness, and will hold thine hand, and will keep thee, and give thee for a covenant of the people, for a light of the Gentiles;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To open the blind eyes, to bring out the prisoners from the prison, and them that sit in darkness out of the prison house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord: that is my name: and my glory will I not give to another, neither my praise to graven images.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the former things are come to pass, and new things do I declare: before they spring forth I tell you of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing unto the Lord a new song, and his praise from the end of the earth, ye that go down to the sea, and all that is therein; the isles, and the inhabitants thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the wilderness and the cities thereof lift up their voice, the villages that Kedar doth inhabit: let the inhabitants of the rock sing, let them shout from the top of the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them give glory unto the Lord, and declare his praise in the islands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord shall go forth as a mighty man, he shall stir up jealousy like a man of war: he shall cry, yea, roar; he shall prevail against his enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have long time holden my peace; I have been still, and refrained myself: now will I cry like a travailing woman; I will destroy and devour at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make waste mountains and hills, and dry up all their herbs; and I will make the rivers islands, and I will dry up the pools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will bring the blind by a way that they knew not; I will lead them in paths that they have not known: I will make darkness light before them, and crooked things straight. These things will I do unto them, and not forsake them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be turned back, they shall be greatly ashamed, that trust in graven images, that say to the molten images, Ye are our gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear, ye deaf; and look, ye blind, that ye may see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is blind, but my servant? or deaf, as my messenger that I sent? who is blind as he that is perfect, and blind as the Lordâ€™S servant?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing many things, but thou observest not; opening the ears, but he heareth not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is well pleased for his righteousnessâ€™ sake; he will magnify the law, and make it honourable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this is a people robbed and spoiled; they are all of them snared in holes, and they are hid in prison houses: they are for a prey, and none delivereth; for a spoil, and none saith, Restore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who among you will give ear to this? who will hearken and hear for the time to come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who gave Jacob for a spoil, and Israel to the robbers? did not the Lord, he against whom we have sinned? for they would not walk in his ways, neither were they obedient unto his law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he hath poured upon him the fury of his anger, and the strength of battle: and it hath set him on fire round about, yet he knew not; and it burned him, yet he laid it not to heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now thus saith the Lord that created thee, O Jacob, and he that formed thee, O Israel, Fear not: for I have redeemed thee, I have called thee by thy name; thou art mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee; and through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame kindle upon thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am the Lord thy God, the Holy One of Israel, thy Saviour: I gave Egypt for thy ransom, Ethiopia and Seba for thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since thou wast precious in my sight, thou hast been honourable, and I have loved thee: therefore will I give men for thee, and people for thy life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear not: for I am with thee: I will bring thy seed from the east, and gather thee from the west;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will say to the north, Give up; and to the south, Keep not back: bring my sons from far, and my daughters from the ends of the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even every one that is called by my name: for I have created him for my glory, I have formed him; yea, I have made him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring forth the blind people that have eyes, and the deaf that have ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let all the nations be gathered together, and let the people be assembled: who among them can declare this, and shew us former things? let them bring forth their witnesses, that they may be justified: or let them hear, and say, It is truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye are my witnesses, saith the Lord, and my servant whom I have chosen: that ye may know and believe me, and understand that I am he: before me there was no God formed, neither shall there be after me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, even I, am the Lord; and beside me there is no saviour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have declared, and have saved, and I have shewed, when there was no strange god among you: therefore ye are my witnesses, saith the Lord, that I am God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, before the day was I am he; and there is none that can deliver out of my hand: I will work, and who shall let it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord, your redeemer, the Holy One of Israel; For your sake I have sent to Babylon, and have brought down all their nobles, and the Chaldeans, whose cry is in the ships.
verses.speaker: Narrator
