verses.text: I am the Lord, your Holy One, the creator of Israel, your King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord, which maketh a way in the sea, and a path in the mighty waters;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which bringeth forth the chariot and horse, the army and the power; they shall lie down together, they shall not rise: they are extinct, they are quenched as tow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember ye not the former things, neither consider the things of old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will do a new thing; now it shall spring forth; shall ye not know it? I will even make a way in the wilderness, and rivers in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beast of the field shall honour me, the dragons and the owls: because I give waters in the wilderness, and rivers in the desert, to give drink to my people, my chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This people have I formed for myself; they shall shew forth my praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thou hast not called upon me, O Jacob; but thou hast been weary of me, O Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast not brought me the small cattle of thy burnt offerings; neither hast thou honoured me with thy sacrifices. I have not caused thee to serve with an offering, nor wearied thee with incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast bought me no sweet cane with money, neither hast thou filled me with the fat of thy sacrifices: but thou hast made me to serve with thy sins, thou hast wearied me with thine iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, even I, am he that blotteth out thy transgressions for mine own sake, and will not remember thy sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put me in remembrance: let us plead together: declare thou, that thou mayest be justified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy first father hath sinned, and thy teachers have transgressed against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I have profaned the princes of the sanctuary, and have given Jacob to the curse, and Israel to reproaches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet now hear, O Jacob my servant; and Israel, whom I have chosen:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord that made thee, and formed thee from the womb, which will help thee; Fear not, O Jacob, my servant; and thou, Jesurun, whom I have chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will pour water upon him that is thirsty, and floods upon the dry ground: I will pour my Spirit upon thy seed, and my blessing upon thine offspring:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall spring up as among the grass, as willows by the water courses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One shall say, I am the Lordâ€™S; and another shall call himself by the name of Jacob; and another shall subscribe with his hand unto the Lord, and surname himself by the name of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord the King of Israel, and his redeemer the Lord of hosts; I am the first, and I am the last; and beside me there is no God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And who, as I, shall call, and shall declare it, and set it in order for me, since I appointed the ancient people? and the things that are coming, and shall come, let them shew unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear ye not, neither be afraid: have not I told thee from that time, and have declared it? ye are even my witnesses. Is there a God beside me? yea, there is no God; I know not any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They that make a graven image are all of them vanity; and their delectable things shall not profit; and they are their own witnesses; they see not, nor know; that they may be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who hath formed a god, or molten a graven image that is profitable for nothing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, all his fellows shall be ashamed: and the workmen, they are of men: let them all be gathered together, let them stand up; yet they shall fear, and they shall be ashamed together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The smith with the tongs both worketh in the coals, and fashioneth it with hammers, and worketh it with the strength of his arms: yea, he is hungry, and his strength faileth: he drinketh no water, and is faint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The carpenter stretcheth out his rule; he marketh it out with a line; he fitteth it with planes, and he marketh it out with the compass, and maketh it after the figure of a man, according to the beauty of a man; that it may remain in the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He heweth him down cedars, and taketh the cypress and the oak, which he strengtheneth for himself among the trees of the forest: he planteth an ash, and the rain doth nourish it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall it be for a man to burn: for he will take thereof, and warm himself; yea, he kindleth it, and baketh bread; yea, he maketh a god, and worshippeth it; he maketh it a graven image, and falleth down thereto.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He burneth part thereof in the fire; with part thereof he eateth flesh; he roasteth roast, and is satisfied: yea, he warmeth himself, and saith, Aha, I am warm, I have seen the fire:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the residue thereof he maketh a god, even his graven image: he falleth down unto it, and worshippeth it, and prayeth unto it, and saith, Deliver me; for thou art my god.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have not known nor understood: for he hath shut their eyes, that they cannot see; and their hearts, that they cannot understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And none considereth in his heart, neither is there knowledge nor understanding to say, I have burned part of it in the fire; yea, also I have baked bread upon the coals thereof; I have roasted flesh, and eaten it: and shall I make the residue thereof an abomination? shall I fall down to the stock of a tree?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He feedeth on ashes: a deceived heart hath turned him aside, that he cannot deliver his soul, nor say, Is there not a lie in my right hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember these, O Jacob and Israel; for thou art my servant: I have formed thee; thou art my servant: O Israel, thou shalt not be forgotten of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, thy transgressions, and, as a cloud, thy sins: return unto me; for I have redeemed thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing, O ye heavens; for the Lord hath done it: shout, ye lower parts of the earth: break forth into singing, ye mountains, O forest, and every tree therein: for the Lord hath redeemed Jacob, and glorified himself in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord, thy redeemer, and he that formed thee from the womb, I am the Lord that maketh all things; that stretcheth forth the heavens alone; that spreadeth abroad the earth by myself;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That frustrateth the tokens of the liars, and maketh diviners mad; that turneth wise men backward, and maketh their knowledge foolish;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That confirmeth the word of his servant, and performeth the counsel of his messengers; that saith to Jerusalem, Thou shalt be inhabited; and to the cities of Judah, Ye shall be built, and I will raise up the decayed places thereof:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That saith to the deep, Be dry, and I will dry up thy rivers:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That saith of Cyrus, He is my shepherd, and shall perform all my pleasure: even saying to Jerusalem, Thou shalt be built; and to the temple, Thy foundation shall be laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord to his anointed, to Cyrus, whose right hand I have holden, to subdue nations before him; and I will loose the loins of kings, to open before him the two leaved gates; and the gates shall not be shut;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will go before thee, and make the crooked places straight: I will break in pieces the gates of brass, and cut in sunder the bars of iron:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will give thee the treasures of darkness, and hidden riches of secret places, that thou mayest know that I, the Lord, which call thee by thy name, am the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jacob my servantâ€™s sake, and Israel mine elect, I have even called thee by thy name: I have surnamed thee, though thou hast not known me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord, and there is none else, there is no God beside me: I girded thee, though thou hast not known me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That they may know from the rising of the sun, and from the west, that there is none beside me. I am the Lord, and there is none else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I form the light, and create darkness: I make peace, and create evil: I the Lord do all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Drop down, ye heavens, from above, and let the skies pour down righteousness: let the earth open, and let them bring forth salvation, and let righteousness spring up together; I the Lord have created it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe unto him that striveth with his Maker! Let the potsherd strive with the potsherds of the earth. Shall the clay say to him that fashioneth it, What makest thou? or thy work, He hath no hands?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe unto him that saith unto his father, What begettest thou? or to the woman, What hast thou brought forth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord, the Holy One of Israel, and his Maker, Ask me of things to come concerning my sons, and concerning the work of my hands command ye me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have made the earth, and created man upon it: I, even my hands, have stretched out the heavens, and all their host have I commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have raised him up in righteousness, and I will direct all his ways: he shall build my city, and he shall let go my captives, not for price nor reward, saith the Lord of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord, The labour of Egypt, and merchandise of Ethiopia and of the Sabeans, men of stature, shall come over unto thee, and they shall be thine: they shall come after thee; in chains they shall come over, and they shall fall down unto thee, they shall make supplication unto thee, saying, Surely God is in thee; and there is none else, there is no God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily thou art a God that hidest thyself, O God of Israel, the Saviour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be ashamed, and also confounded, all of them: they shall go to confusion together that are makers of idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Israel shall be saved in the Lord with an everlasting salvation: ye shall not be ashamed nor confounded world without end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus saith the Lord that created the heavens; God himself that formed the earth and made it; he hath established it, he created it not in vain, he formed it to be inhabited: I am the Lord; and there is none else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not spoken in secret, in a dark place of the earth: I said not unto the seed of Jacob, Seek ye me in vain: I the Lord speak righteousness, I declare things that are right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Assemble yourselves and come; draw near together, ye that are escaped of the nations: they have no knowledge that set up the wood of their graven image, and pray unto a god that cannot save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell ye, and bring them near; yea, let them take counsel together: who hath declared this from ancient time? who hath told it from that time? have not I the Lord? and there is no God else beside me; a just God and a Saviour; there is none beside me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look unto me, and be ye saved, all the ends of the earth: for I am God, and there is none else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have sworn by myself, the word is gone out of my mouth in righteousness, and shall not return, That unto me every knee shall bow, every tongue shall swear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely, shall one say, in the Lord have I righteousness and strength: even to him shall men come; and all that are incensed against him shall be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the Lord shall all the seed of Israel be justified, and shall glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bel boweth down, Nebo stoopeth, their idols were upon the beasts, and upon the cattle: your carriages were heavy loaden; they are a burden to the weary beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They stoop, they bow down together; they could not deliver the burden, but themselves are gone into captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hearken unto me, O house of Jacob, and all the remnant of the house of Israel, which are borne by me from the belly, which are carried from the womb:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even to your old age I am he; and even to hoar hairs will I carry you: I have made, and I will bear; even I will carry, and will deliver you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom will ye liken me, and make me equal, and compare me, that we may be like?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They lavish gold out of the bag, and weigh silver in the balance, and hire a goldsmith; and he maketh it a god: they fall down, yea, they worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They bear him upon the shoulder, they carry him, and set him in his place, and he standeth; from his place shall he not remove: yea, one shall cry unto him, yet can he not answer, nor save him out of his trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember this, and shew yourselves men: bring it again to mind, O ye transgressors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember the former things of old: for I am God, and there is none else; I am God, and there is none like me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Declaring the end from the beginning, and from ancient times the things that are not yet done, saying, My counsel shall stand, and I will do all my pleasure:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Calling a ravenous bird from the east, the man that executeth my counsel from a far country: yea, I have spoken it, I will also bring it to pass; I have purposed it, I will also do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hearken unto me, ye stouthearted, that are far from righteousness:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I bring near my righteousness; it shall not be far off, and my salvation shall not tarry: and I will place salvation in Zion for Israel my glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come down, and sit in the dust, O virgin daughter of Babylon, sit on the ground: there is no throne, O daughter of the Chaldeans: for thou shalt no more be called tender and delicate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the millstones, and grind meal: uncover thy locks, make bare the leg, uncover the thigh, pass over the rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy nakedness shall be uncovered, yea, thy shame shall be seen: I will take vengeance, and I will not meet thee as a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for our redeemer, the Lord of hosts is his name, the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sit thou silent, and get thee into darkness, O daughter of the Chaldeans: for thou shalt no more be called, The lady of kingdoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was wroth with my people, I have polluted mine inheritance, and given them into thine hand: thou didst shew them no mercy; upon the ancient hast thou very heavily laid thy yoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou saidst, I shall be a lady for ever: so that thou didst not lay these things to thy heart, neither didst remember the latter end of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore hear now this, thou that art given to pleasures, that dwellest carelessly, that sayest in thine heart, I am, and none else beside me; I shall not sit as a widow, neither shall I know the loss of children:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these two things shall come to thee in a moment in one day, the loss of children, and widowhood: they shall come upon thee in their perfection for the multitude of thy sorceries, and for the great abundance of thine enchantments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou hast trusted in thy wickedness: thou hast said, None seeth me. Thy wisdom and thy knowledge, it hath perverted thee; and thou hast said in thine heart, I am, and none else beside me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore shall evil come upon thee; thou shalt not know from whence it riseth: and mischief shall fall upon thee; thou shalt not be able to put it off: and desolation shall come upon thee suddenly, which thou shalt not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stand now with thine enchantments, and with the multitude of thy sorceries, wherein thou hast laboured from thy youth; if so be thou shalt be able to profit, if so be thou mayest prevail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou art wearied in the multitude of thy counsels. Let now the astrologers, the stargazers, the monthly prognosticators, stand up, and save thee from these things that shall come upon thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, they shall be as stubble; the fire shall burn them; they shall not deliver themselves from the power of the flame: there shall not be a coal to warm at, nor fire to sit before it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus shall they be unto thee with whom thou hast laboured, even thy merchants, from thy youth: they shall wander every one to his quarter; none shall save thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear ye this, O house of Jacob, which are called by the name of Israel, and are come forth out of the waters of Judah, which swear by the name of the Lord, and make mention of the God of Israel, but not in truth, nor in righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they call themselves of the holy city, and stay themselves upon the God of Israel; The Lord of hosts is his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have declared the former things from the beginning; and they went forth out of my mouth, and I shewed them; I did them suddenly, and they came to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because I knew that thou art obstinate, and thy neck is an iron sinew, and thy brow brass;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have even from the beginning declared it to thee; before it came to pass I shewed it thee: lest thou shouldest say, Mine idol hath done them, and my graven image, and my molten image, hath commanded them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast heard, see all this; and will not ye declare it? I have shewed thee new things from this time, even hidden things, and thou didst not know them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are created now, and not from the beginning; even before the day when thou heardest them not; lest thou shouldest say, Behold, I knew them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, thou heardest not; yea, thou knewest not; yea, from that time that thine ear was not opened: for I knew that thou wouldest deal very treacherously, and wast called a transgressor from the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my nameâ€™s sake will I defer mine anger, and for my praise will I refrain for thee, that I cut thee not off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have refined thee, but not with silver; I have chosen thee in the furnace of affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For mine own sake, even for mine own sake, will I do it: for how should my name be polluted? and I will not give my glory unto another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hearken unto me, O Jacob and Israel, my called; I am he; I am the first, I also am the last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mine hand also hath laid the foundation of the earth, and my right hand hath spanned the heavens: when I call unto them, they stand up together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All ye, assemble yourselves, and hear; which among them hath declared these things? The Lord hath loved him: he will do his pleasure on Babylon, and his arm shall be on the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, even I, have spoken; yea, I have called him: I have brought him, and he shall make his way prosperous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come ye near unto me, hear ye this; I have not spoken in secret from the beginning; from the time that it was, there am I: and now the Lord God, and his Spirit, hath sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord, thy Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel; I am the Lord thy God which teacheth thee to profit, which leadeth thee by the way that thou shouldest go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O that thou hadst hearkened to my commandments! then had thy peace been as a river, and thy righteousness as the waves of the sea:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy seed also had been as the sand, and the offspring of thy bowels like the gravel thereof; his name should not have been cut off nor destroyed from before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go ye forth of Babylon, flee ye from the Chaldeans, with a voice of singing declare ye, tell this, utter it even to the end of the earth; say ye, The Lord hath redeemed his servant Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they thirsted not when he led them through the deserts: he caused the waters to flow out of the rock for them: he clave the rock also, and the waters gushed out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no peace, saith the Lord, unto the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen, O isles, unto me; and hearken, ye people, from far; The Lord hath called me from the womb; from the bowels of my mother hath he made mention of my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he hath made my mouth like a sharp sword; in the shadow of his hand hath he hid me, and made me a polished shaft; in his quiver hath he hid me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto me, Thou art my servant, O Israel, in whom I will be glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, I have laboured in vain, I have spent my strength for nought, and in vain: yet surely my judgment is with the Lord, and my work with my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, saith the Lord that formed me from the womb to be his servant, to bring Jacob again to him, Though Israel be not gathered, yet shall I be glorious in the eyes of the Lord, and my God shall be my strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, It is a light thing that thou shouldest be my servant to raise up the tribes of Jacob, and to restore the preserved of Israel: I will also give thee for a light to the Gentiles, that thou mayest be my salvation unto the end of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord, the Redeemer of Israel, and his Holy One, to him whom man despiseth, to him whom the nation abhorreth, to a servant of rulers, Kings shall see and arise, princes also shall worship, because of the Lord that is faithful, and the Holy One of Israel, and he shall choose thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord, In an acceptable time have I heard thee, and in a day of salvation have I helped thee: and I will preserve thee, and give thee for a covenant of the people, to establish the earth, to cause to inherit the desolate heritages;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That thou mayest say to the prisoners, Go forth; to them that are in darkness, Shew yourselves. They shall feed in the ways, and their pastures shall be in all high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not hunger nor thirst; neither shall the heat nor sun smite them: for he that hath mercy on them shall lead them, even by the springs of water shall he guide them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make all my mountains a way, and my highways shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, these shall come from far: and, lo, these from the north and from the west; and these from the land of Sinim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing, O heavens; and be joyful, O earth; and break forth into singing, O mountains: for the Lord hath comforted his people, and will have mercy upon his afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Zion said, The Lord hath forsaken me, and my Lord hath forgotten me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can a woman forget her sucking child, that she should not have compassion on the son of her womb? yea, they may forget, yet will I not forget thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have graven thee upon the palms of my hands; thy walls are continually before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy children shall make haste; thy destroyers and they that made thee waste shall go forth of thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lift up thine eyes round about, and behold: all these gather themselves together, and come to thee. As I live, saith the Lord, thou shalt surely clothe thee with them all, as with an ornament, and bind them on thee, as a bride doeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thy waste and thy desolate places, and the land of thy destruction, shall even now be too narrow by reason of the inhabitants, and they that swallowed thee up shall be far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children which thou shalt have, after thou hast lost the other, shall say again in thine ears, The place is too strait for me: give place to me that I may dwell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shalt thou say in thine heart, Who hath begotten me these, seeing I have lost my children, and am desolate, a captive, and removing to and fro? and who hath brought up these? Behold, I was left alone; these, where had they been?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord God, Behold, I will lift up mine hand to the Gentiles, and set up my standard to the people: and they shall bring thy sons in their arms, and thy daughters shall be carried upon their shoulders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And kings shall be thy nursing fathers, and their queens thy nursing mothers: they shall bow down to thee with their face toward the earth, and lick up the dust of thy feet; and thou shalt know that I am the Lord: for they shall not be ashamed that wait for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall the prey be taken from the mighty, or the lawful captive delivered?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thus saith the Lord, Even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away, and the prey of the terrible shall be delivered: for I will contend with him that contendeth with thee, and I will save thy children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will feed them that oppress thee with their own flesh; and they shall be drunken with their own blood, as with sweet wine: and all flesh shall know that I the Lord am thy Saviour and thy Redeemer, the mighty One of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord, Where is the bill of your motherâ€™s divorcement, whom I have put away? or which of my creditors is it to whom I have sold you? Behold, for your iniquities have ye sold yourselves, and for your transgressions is your mother put away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore, when I came, was there no man? when I called, was there none to answer? Is my hand shortened at all, that it cannot redeem? or have I no power to deliver? behold, at my rebuke I dry up the sea, I make the rivers a wilderness: their fish stinketh, because there is no water, and dieth for thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I clothe the heavens with blackness, and I make sackcloth their covering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord God hath given me the tongue of the learned, that I should know how to speak a word in season to him that is weary: he wakeneth morning by morning, he wakeneth mine ear to hear as the learned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord God hath opened mine ear, and I was not rebellious, neither turned away back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave my back to the smiters, and my cheeks to them that plucked off the hair: I hid not my face from shame and spitting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord God will help me; therefore shall I not be confounded: therefore have I set my face like a flint, and I know that I shall not be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is near that justifieth me; who will contend with me? let us stand together: who is mine adversary? let him come near to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the Lord God will help me; who is he that shall condemn me? lo, they all shall wax old as a garment; the moth shall eat them up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is among you that feareth the Lord, that obeyeth the voice of his servant, that walketh in darkness, and hath no light? let him trust in the name of the Lord, and stay upon his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, all ye that kindle a fire, that compass yourselves about with sparks: walk in the light of your fire, and in the sparks that ye have kindled. This shall ye have of mine hand; ye shall lie down in sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hearken to me, ye that follow after righteousness, ye that seek the Lord: look unto the rock whence ye are hewn, and to the hole of the pit whence ye are digged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look unto Abraham your father, and unto Sarah that bare you: for I called him alone, and blessed him, and increased him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord shall comfort Zion: he will comfort all her waste places; and he will make her wilderness like Eden, and her desert like the garden of the Lord; joy and gladness shall be found therein, thanksgiving, and the voice of melody.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hearken unto me, my people; and give ear unto me, O my nation: for a law shall proceed from me, and I will make my judgment to rest for a light of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My righteousness is near; my salvation is gone forth, and mine arms shall judge the people; the isles shall wait upon me, and on mine arm shall they trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lift up your eyes to the heavens, and look upon the earth beneath: for the heavens shall vanish away like smoke, and the earth shall wax old like a garment, and they that dwell therein shall die in like manner: but my salvation shall be for ever, and my righteousness shall not be abolished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hearken unto me, ye that know righteousness, the people in whose heart is my law; fear ye not the reproach of men, neither be ye afraid of their revilings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the moth shall eat them up like a garment, and the worm shall eat them like wool: but my righteousness shall be for ever, and my salvation from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Awake, awake, put on strength, O arm of the Lord; awake, as in the ancient days, in the generations of old. Art thou not it that hath cut Rahab, and wounded the dragon?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Art thou not it which hath dried the sea, the waters of the great deep; that hath made the depths of the sea a way for the ransomed to pass over?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the redeemed of the Lord shall return, and come with singing unto Zion; and everlasting joy shall be upon their head: they shall obtain gladness and joy; and sorrow and mourning shall flee away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, even I, am he that comforteth you: who art thou, that thou shouldest be afraid of a man that shall die, and of the son of man which shall be made as grass;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And forgettest the Lord thy maker, that hath stretched forth the heavens, and laid the foundations of the earth; and hast feared continually every day because of the fury of the oppressor, as if he were ready to destroy? and where is the fury of the oppressor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The captive exile hasteneth that he may be loosed, and that he should not die in the pit, nor that his bread should fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I am the Lord thy God, that divided the sea, whose waves roared: The Lord of hosts is his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have put my words in thy mouth, and I have covered thee in the shadow of mine hand, that I may plant the heavens, and lay the foundations of the earth, and say unto Zion, Thou art my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Awake, awake, stand up, O Jerusalem, which hast drunk at the hand of the Lord the cup of his fury; thou hast drunken the dregs of the cup of trembling, and wrung them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is none to guide her among all the sons whom she hath brought forth; neither is there any that taketh her by the hand of all the sons that she hath brought up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These two things are come unto thee; who shall be sorry for thee? desolation, and destruction, and the famine, and the sword: by whom shall I comfort thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy sons have fainted, they lie at the head of all the streets, as a wild bull in a net: they are full of the fury of the Lord, the rebuke of thy God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore hear now this, thou afflicted, and drunken, but not with wine:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith thy Lord the Lord, and thy God that pleadeth the cause of his people, Behold, I have taken out of thine hand the cup of trembling, even the dregs of the cup of my fury; thou shalt no more drink it again:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will put it into the hand of them that afflict thee; which have said to thy soul, Bow down, that we may go over: and thou hast laid thy body as the ground, and as the street, to them that went over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Awake, awake; put on thy strength, O Zion; put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city: for henceforth there shall no more come into thee the uncircumcised and the unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shake thyself from the dust; arise, and sit down, O Jerusalem: loose thyself from the bands of thy neck, O captive daughter of Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus saith the Lord, Ye have sold yourselves for nought; and ye shall be redeemed without money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus saith the Lord God, My people went down aforetime into Egypt to sojourn there; and the Assyrian oppressed them without cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, what have I here, saith the Lord, that my people is taken away for nought? they that rule over them make them to howl, saith the Lord; and my name continually every day is blasphemed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore my people shall know my name: therefore they shall know in that day that I am he that doth speak: behold, it is I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him that bringeth good tidings, that publisheth peace; that bringeth good tidings of good, that publisheth salvation; that saith unto Zion, Thy God reigneth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy watchmen shall lift up the voice; with the voice together shall they sing: for they shall see eye to eye, when the Lord shall bring again Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Break forth into joy, sing together, ye waste places of Jerusalem: for the Lord hath comforted his people, he hath redeemed Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord hath made bare his holy arm in the eyes of all the nations; and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Depart ye, depart ye, go ye out from thence, touch no unclean thing; go ye out of the midst of her; be ye clean, that bear the vessels of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye shall not go out with haste, nor go by flight: for the Lord will go before you; and the God of Israel will be your rereward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, my servant shall deal prudently, he shall be exalted and extolled, and be very high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As many were astonied at thee; his visage was so marred more than any man, and his form more than the sons of men:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So shall he sprinkle many nations; the kings shall shut their mouths at him: for that which had not been told them shall they see; and that which they had not heard shall they consider.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who hath believed our report? and to whom is the arm of the Lord revealed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he shall grow up before him as a tender plant, and as a root out of a dry ground: he hath no form nor comeliness; and when we shall see him, there is no beauty that we should desire him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is despised and rejected of men; a man of sorrows, and acquainted with grief: and we hid as it were our faces from him; he was despised, and we esteemed him not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely he hath borne our griefs, and carried our sorrows: yet we did esteem him stricken, smitten of God, and afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he was wounded for our transgressions, he was bruised for our iniquities: the chastisement of our peace was upon him; and with his stripes we are healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All we like sheep have gone astray; we have turned every one to his own way; and the Lord hath laid on him the iniquity of us all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was oppressed, and he was afflicted, yet he opened not his mouth: he is brought as a lamb to the slaughter, and as a sheep before her shearers is dumb, so he openeth not his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was taken from prison and from judgment: and who shall declare his generation? for he was cut off out of the land of the living: for the transgression of my people was he stricken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made his grave with the wicked, and with the rich in his death; because he had done no violence, neither was any deceit in his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet it pleased the Lord to bruise him; he hath put him to grief: when thou shalt make his soul an offering for sin, he shall see his seed, he shall prolong his days, and the pleasure of the Lord shall prosper in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall see of the travail of his soul, and shall be satisfied: by his knowledge shall my righteous servant justify many; for he shall bear their iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore will I divide him a portion with the great, and he shall divide the spoil with the strong; because he hath poured out his soul unto death: and he was numbered with the transgressors; and he bare the sin of many, and made intercession for the transgressors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing, O barren, thou that didst not bear; break forth into singing, and cry aloud, thou that didst not travail with child: for more are the children of the desolate than the children of the married wife, saith the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enlarge the place of thy tent, and let them stretch forth the curtains of thine habitations: spare not, lengthen thy cords, and strengthen thy stakes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou shalt break forth on the right hand and on the left; and thy seed shall inherit the Gentiles, and make the desolate cities to be inhabited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear not; for thou shalt not be ashamed: neither be thou confounded; for thou shalt not be put to shame: for thou shalt forget the shame of thy youth, and shalt not remember the reproach of thy widowhood any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thy Maker is thine husband; the Lord of hosts is his name; and thy Redeemer the Holy One of Israel; The God of the whole earth shall he be called.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord hath called thee as a woman forsaken and grieved in spirit, and a wife of youth, when thou wast refused, saith thy God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a small moment have I forsaken thee; but with great mercies will I gather thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a little wrath I hid my face from thee for a moment; but with everlasting kindness will I have mercy on thee, saith the Lord thy Redeemer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is as the waters of Noah unto me: for as I have sworn that the waters of Noah should no more go over the earth; so have I sworn that I would not be wroth with thee, nor rebuke thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the mountains shall depart, and the hills be removed; but my kindness shall not depart from thee, neither shall the covenant of my peace be removed, saith the Lord that hath mercy on thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O thou afflicted, tossed with tempest, and not comforted, behold, I will lay thy stones with fair colours, and lay thy foundations with sapphires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make thy windows of agates, and thy gates of carbuncles, and all thy borders of pleasant stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all thy children shall be taught of the Lord; and great shall be the peace of thy children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In righteousness shalt thou be established: thou shalt be far from oppression; for thou shalt not fear: and from terror; for it shall not come near thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, they shall surely gather together, but not by me: whosoever shall gather together against thee shall fall for thy sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have created the smith that bloweth the coals in the fire, and that bringeth forth an instrument for his work; and I have created the waster to destroy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No weapon that is formed against thee shall prosper; and every tongue that shall rise against thee in judgment thou shalt condemn. This is the heritage of the servants of the Lord, and their righteousness is of me, saith the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ho, every one that thirsteth, come ye to the waters, and he that hath no money; come ye, buy, and eat; yea, come, buy wine and milk without money and without price.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore do ye spend money for that which is not bread? and your labour for that which satisfieth not? hearken diligently unto me, and eat ye that which is good, and let your soul delight itself in fatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Incline your ear, and come unto me: hear, and your soul shall live; and I will make an everlasting covenant with you, even the sure mercies of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have given him for a witness to the people, a leader and commander to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, thou shalt call a nation that thou knowest not, and nations that knew not thee shall run unto thee because of the Lord thy God, and for the Holy One of Israel; for he hath glorified thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seek ye the Lord while he may be found, call ye upon him while he is near:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the wicked forsake his way, and the unrighteous man his thoughts: and let him return unto the Lord, and he will have mercy upon him; and to our God, for he will abundantly pardon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways my ways, saith the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways, and my thoughts than your thoughts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the rain cometh down, and the snow from heaven, and returneth not thither, but watereth the earth, and maketh it bring forth and bud, that it may give seed to the sower, and bread to the eater:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So shall my word be that goeth forth out of my mouth: it shall not return unto me void, but it shall accomplish that which I please, and it shall prosper in the thing whereto I sent it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye shall go out with joy, and be led forth with peace: the mountains and the hills shall break forth before you into singing, and all the trees of the field shall clap their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead of the thorn shall come up the fir tree, and instead of the brier shall come up the myrtle tree: and it shall be to the Lord for a name, for an everlasting sign that shall not be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord, Keep ye judgment, and do justice: for my salvation is near to come, and my righteousness to be revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is the man that doeth this, and the son of man that layeth hold on it; that keepeth the sabbath from polluting it, and keepeth his hand from doing any evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither let the son of the stranger, that hath joined himself to the Lord, speak, saying, The Lord hath utterly separated me from his people: neither let the eunuch say, Behold, I am a dry tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus saith the Lord unto the eunuchs that keep my sabbaths, and choose the things that please me, and take hold of my covenant;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even unto them will I give in mine house and within my walls a place and a name better than of sons and of daughters: I will give them an everlasting name, that shall not be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also the sons of the stranger, that join themselves to the Lord, to serve him, and to love the name of the Lord, to be his servants, every one that keepeth the sabbath from polluting it, and taketh hold of my covenant;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even them will I bring to my holy mountain, and make them joyful in my house of prayer: their burnt offerings and their sacrifices shall be accepted upon mine altar; for mine house shall be called an house of prayer for all people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord God which gathereth the outcasts of Israel saith, Yet will I gather others to him, beside those that are gathered unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All ye beasts of the field, come to devour, yea, all ye beasts in the forest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His watchmen are blind: they are all ignorant, they are all dumb dogs, they cannot bark; sleeping, lying down, loving to slumber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, they are greedy dogs which can never have enough, and they are shepherds that cannot understand: they all look to their own way, every one for his gain, from his quarter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come ye, say they, I will fetch wine, and we will fill ourselves with strong drink; and to morrow shall be as this day, and much more abundant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The righteous perisheth, and no man layeth it to heart: and merciful men are taken away, none considering that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall enter into peace: they shall rest in their beds, each one walking in his uprightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But draw near hither, ye sons of the sorceress, the seed of the adulterer and the whore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Against whom do ye sport yourselves? against whom make ye a wide mouth, and draw out the tongue? are ye not children of transgression, a seed of falsehood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enflaming yourselves with idols under every green tree, slaying the children in the valleys under the clifts of the rocks?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among the smooth stones of the stream is thy portion; they, they are thy lot: even to them hast thou poured a drink offering, thou hast offered a meat offering. Should I receive comfort in these?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Upon a lofty and high mountain hast thou set thy bed: even thither wentest thou up to offer sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behind the doors also and the posts hast thou set up thy remembrance: for thou hast discovered thyself to another than me, and art gone up; thou hast enlarged thy bed, and made thee a covenant with them; thou lovedst their bed where thou sawest it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou wentest to the king with ointment, and didst increase thy perfumes, and didst send thy messengers far off, and didst debase thyself even unto hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou art wearied in the greatness of thy way; yet saidst thou not, There is no hope: thou hast found the life of thine hand; therefore thou wast not grieved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of whom hast thou been afraid or feared, that thou hast lied, and hast not remembered me, nor laid it to thy heart? have not I held my peace even of old, and thou fearest me not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will declare thy righteousness, and thy works; for they shall not profit thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When thou criest, let thy companies deliver thee; but the wind shall carry them all away; vanity shall take them: but he that putteth his trust in me shall possess the land, and shall inherit my holy mountain;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And shall say, Cast ye up, cast ye up, prepare the way, take up the stumblingblock out of the way of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus saith the high and lofty One that inhabiteth eternity, whose name is Holy; I dwell in the high and holy place, with him also that is of a contrite and humble spirit, to revive the spirit of the humble, and to revive the heart of the contrite ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will not contend for ever, neither will I be always wroth: for the spirit should fail before me, and the souls which I have made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the iniquity of his covetousness was I wroth, and smote him: I hid me, and was wroth, and he went on frowardly in the way of his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have seen his ways, and will heal him: I will lead him also, and restore comforts unto him and to his mourners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I create the fruit of the lips; Peace, peace to him that is far off, and to him that is near, saith the Lord; and I will heal him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the wicked are like the troubled sea, when it cannot rest, whose waters cast up mire and dirt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no peace, saith my God, to the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cry aloud, spare not, lift up thy voice like a trumpet, and shew my people their transgression, and the house of Jacob their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they seek me daily, and delight to know my ways, as a nation that did righteousness, and forsook not the ordinance of their God: they ask of me the ordinances of justice; they take delight in approaching to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore have we fasted, say they, and thou seest not? wherefore have we afflicted our soul, and thou takest no knowledge? Behold, in the day of your fast ye find pleasure, and exact all your labours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, ye fast for strife and debate, and to smite with the fist of wickedness: ye shall not fast as ye do this day, to make your voice to be heard on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it such a fast that I have chosen? a day for a man to afflict his soul? is it to bow down his head as a bulrush, and to spread sackcloth and ashes under him? wilt thou call this a fast, and an acceptable day to the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not this the fast that I have chosen? to loose the bands of wickedness, to undo the heavy burdens, and to let the oppressed go free, and that ye break every yoke?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it not to deal thy bread to the hungry, and that thou bring the poor that are cast out to thy house? when thou seest the naked, that thou cover him; and that thou hide not thyself from thine own flesh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall thy light break forth as the morning, and thine health shall spring forth speedily: and thy righteousness shall go before thee; the glory of the Lord shall be thy rereward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shalt thou call, and the Lord shall answer; thou shalt cry, and he shall say, Here I am. If thou take away from the midst of thee the yoke, the putting forth of the finger, and speaking vanity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if thou draw out thy soul to the hungry, and satisfy the afflicted soul; then shall thy light rise in obscurity, and thy darkness be as the noonday:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord shall guide thee continually, and satisfy thy soul in drought, and make fat thy bones: and thou shalt be like a watered garden, and like a spring of water, whose waters fail not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that shall be of thee shall build the old waste places: thou shalt raise up the foundations of many generations; and thou shalt be called, The repairer of the breach, The restorer of paths to dwell in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou turn away thy foot from the sabbath, from doing thy pleasure on my holy day; and call the sabbath a delight, the holy of the Lord, honourable; and shalt honour him, not doing thine own ways, nor finding thine own pleasure, nor speaking thine own words:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shalt thou delight thyself in the Lord; and I will cause thee to ride upon the high places of the earth, and feed thee with the heritage of Jacob thy father: for the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the Lordâ€™S hand is not shortened, that it cannot save; neither his ear heavy, that it cannot hear:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But your iniquities have separated between you and your God, and your sins have hid his face from you, that he will not hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For your hands are defiled with blood, and your fingers with iniquity; your lips have spoken lies, your tongue hath muttered perverseness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None calleth for justice, nor any pleadeth for truth: they trust in vanity, and speak lies; they conceive mischief, and bring forth iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They hatch cockatriceâ€™ eggs, and weave the spiderâ€™s web: he that eateth of their eggs dieth, and that which is crushed breaketh out into a viper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their webs shall not become garments, neither shall they cover themselves with their works: their works are works of iniquity, and the act of violence is in their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their feet run to evil, and they make haste to shed innocent blood: their thoughts are thoughts of iniquity; wasting and destruction are in their paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The way of peace they know not; and there is no judgment in their goings: they have made them crooked paths: whosoever goeth therein shall not know peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore is judgment far from us, neither doth justice overtake us: we wait for light, but behold obscurity; for brightness, but we walk in darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We grope for the wall like the blind, and we grope as if we had no eyes: we stumble at noonday as in the night; we are in desolate places as dead men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We roar all like bears, and mourn sore like doves: we look for judgment, but there is none; for salvation, but it is far off from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For our transgressions are multiplied before thee, and our sins testify against us: for our transgressions are with us; and as for our iniquities, we know them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In transgressing and lying against the Lord, and departing away from our God, speaking oppression and revolt, conceiving and uttering from the heart words of falsehood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And judgment is turned away backward, and justice standeth afar off: for truth is fallen in the street, and equity cannot enter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, truth faileth; and he that departeth from evil maketh himself a prey: and the Lord saw it, and it displeased him that there was no judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he saw that there was no man, and wondered that there was no intercessor: therefore his arm brought salvation unto him; and his righteousness, it sustained him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he put on righteousness as a breastplate, and an helmet of salvation upon his head; and he put on the garments of vengeance for clothing, and was clad with zeal as a cloke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to their deeds, accordingly he will repay, fury to his adversaries, recompence to his enemies; to the islands he will repay recompence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So shall they fear the name of the Lord from the west, and his glory from the rising of the sun. When the enemy shall come in like a flood, the Spirit of the Lord shall lift up a standard against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Redeemer shall come to Zion, and unto them that turn from transgression in Jacob, saith the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for me, this is my covenant with them, saith the Lord; My Spirit that is upon thee, and my words which I have put in thy mouth, shall not depart out of thy mouth, nor out of the mouth of thy seed, nor out of the mouth of thy seedâ€™s seed, saith the Lord, from henceforth and for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arise, shine; for thy light is come, and the glory of the Lord is risen upon thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, behold, the darkness shall cover the earth, and gross darkness the people: but the Lord shall arise upon thee, and his glory shall be seen upon thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Gentiles shall come to thy light, and kings to the brightness of thy rising.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lift up thine eyes round about, and see: all they gather themselves together, they come to thee: thy sons shall come from far, and thy daughters shall be nursed at thy side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then thou shalt see, and flow together, and thine heart shall fear, and be enlarged; because the abundance of the sea shall be converted unto thee, the forces of the Gentiles shall come unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The multitude of camels shall cover thee, the dromedaries of Midian and Ephah; all they from Sheba shall come: they shall bring gold and incense; and they shall shew forth the praises of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the flocks of Kedar shall be gathered together unto thee, the rams of Nebaioth shall minister unto thee: they shall come up with acceptance on mine altar, and I will glorify the house of my glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who are these that fly as a cloud, and as the doves to their windows?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely the isles shall wait for me, and the ships of Tarshish first, to bring thy sons from far, their silver and their gold with them, unto the name of the Lord thy God, and to the Holy One of Israel, because he hath glorified thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of strangers shall build up thy walls, and their kings shall minister unto thee: for in my wrath I smote thee, but in my favour have I had mercy on thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thy gates shall be open continually; they shall not be shut day nor night; that men may bring unto thee the forces of the Gentiles, and that their kings may be brought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the nation and kingdom that will not serve thee shall perish; yea, those nations shall be utterly wasted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The glory of Lebanon shall come unto thee, the fir tree, the pine tree, and the box together, to beautify the place of my sanctuary; and I will make the place of my feet glorious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons also of them that afflicted thee shall come bending unto thee; and all they that despised thee shall bow themselves down at the soles of thy feet; and they shall call thee, The city of the Lord, The Zion of the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whereas thou hast been forsaken and hated, so that no man went through thee, I will make thee an eternal excellency, a joy of many generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt also suck the milk of the Gentiles, and shalt suck the breast of kings: and thou shalt know that I the Lord am thy Saviour and thy Redeemer, the mighty One of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For brass I will bring gold, and for iron I will bring silver, and for wood brass, and for stones iron: I will also make thy officers peace, and thine exactors righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Violence shall no more be heard in thy land, wasting nor destruction within thy borders; but thou shalt call thy walls Salvation, and thy gates Praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sun shall be no more thy light by day; neither for brightness shall the moon give light unto thee: but the Lord shall be unto thee an everlasting light, and thy God thy glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy sun shall no more go down; neither shall thy moon withdraw itself: for the Lord shall be thine everlasting light, and the days of thy mourning shall be ended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy people also shall be all righteous: they shall inherit the land for ever, the branch of my planting, the work of my hands, that I may be glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A little one shall become a thousand, and a small one a strong nation: I the Lord will hasten it in his time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit of the Lord God is upon me; because the Lord hath anointed me to preach good tidings unto the meek; he hath sent me to bind up the brokenhearted, to proclaim liberty to the captives, and the opening of the prison to them that are bound;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To proclaim the acceptable year of the Lord, and the day of vengeance of our God; to comfort all that mourn;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To appoint unto them that mourn in Zion, to give unto them beauty for ashes, the oil of joy for mourning, the garment of praise for the spirit of heaviness; that they might be called trees of righteousness, the planting of the Lord, that he might be glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall build the old wastes, they shall raise up the former desolations, and they shall repair the waste cities, the desolations of many generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And strangers shall stand and feed your flocks, and the sons of the alien shall be your plowmen and your vinedressers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye shall be named the Priests of the Lord: men shall call you the Ministers of our God: ye shall eat the riches of the Gentiles, and in their glory shall ye boast yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For your shame ye shall have double; and for confusion they shall rejoice in their portion: therefore in their land they shall possess the double: everlasting joy shall be unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I the Lord love judgment, I hate robbery for burnt offering; and I will direct their work in truth, and I will make an everlasting covenant with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their seed shall be known among the Gentiles, and their offspring among the people: all that see them shall acknowledge them, that they are the seed which the Lord hath blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will greatly rejoice in the Lord, my soul shall be joyful in my God; for he hath clothed me with the garments of salvation, he hath covered me with the robe of righteousness, as a bridegroom decketh himself with ornaments, and as a bride adorneth herself with her jewels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the earth bringeth forth her bud, and as the garden causeth the things that are sown in it to spring forth; so the Lord God will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth before all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Zionâ€™s sake will I not hold my peace, and for Jerusalemâ€™s sake I will not rest, until the righteousness thereof go forth as brightness, and the salvation thereof as a lamp that burneth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Gentiles shall see thy righteousness, and all kings thy glory: and thou shalt be called by a new name, which the mouth of the Lord shall name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt also be a crown of glory in the hand of the Lord, and a royal diadem in the hand of thy God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou shalt no more be termed Forsaken; neither shall thy land any more be termed Desolate: but thou shalt be called Hephzi-bah, and thy land Beulah: for the Lord delighteth in thee, and thy land shall be married.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as a young man marrieth a virgin, so shall thy sons marry thee: and as the bridegroom rejoiceth over the bride, so shall thy God rejoice over thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have set watchmen upon thy walls, O Jerusalem, which shall never hold their peace day nor night: ye that make mention of the Lord, keep not silence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And give him no rest, till he establish, and till he make Jerusalem a praise in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord hath sworn by his right hand, and by the arm of his strength, Surely I will no more give thy corn to be meat for thine enemies; and the sons of the stranger shall not drink thy wine, for the which thou hast laboured:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they that have gathered it shall eat it, and praise the Lord; and they that have brought it together shall drink it in the courts of my holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go through, go through the gates; prepare ye the way of the people; cast up, cast up the highway; gather out the stones; lift up a standard for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the Lord hath proclaimed unto the end of the world, Say ye to the daughter of Zion, Behold, thy salvation cometh; behold, his reward is with him, and his work before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall call them, The holy people, The redeemed of the Lord: and thou shalt be called, Sought out, A city not forsaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is this that cometh from Edom, with dyed garments from Bozrah? this that is glorious in his apparel, travelling in the greatness of his strength? I that speak in righteousness, mighty to save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore art thou red in thine apparel, and thy garments like him that treadeth in the winefat?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have trodden the winepress alone; and of the people there was none with me: for I will tread them in mine anger, and trample them in my fury; and their blood shall be sprinkled upon my garments, and I will stain all my raiment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the day of vengeance is in mine heart, and the year of my redeemed is come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I looked, and there was none to help; and I wondered that there was none to uphold: therefore mine own arm brought salvation unto me; and my fury, it upheld me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will tread down the people in mine anger, and make them drunk in my fury, and I will bring down their strength to the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will mention the lovingkindnesses of the Lord, and the praises of the Lord, according to all that the Lord hath bestowed on us, and the great goodness toward the house of Israel, which he hath bestowed on them according to his mercies, and according to the multitude of his lovingkindnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he said, Surely they are my people, children that will not lie: so he was their Saviour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all their affliction he was afflicted, and the angel of his presence saved them: in his love and in his pity he redeemed them; and he bare them, and carried them all the days of old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they rebelled, and vexed his holy Spirit: therefore he was turned to be their enemy, and he fought against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he remembered the days of old, Moses, and his people, saying, Where is he that brought them up out of the sea with the shepherd of his flock? where is he that put his holy Spirit within him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That led them by the right hand of Moses with his glorious arm, dividing the water before them, to make himself an everlasting name?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That led them through the deep, as an horse in the wilderness, that they should not stumble?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a beast goeth down into the valley, the Spirit of the Lord caused him to rest: so didst thou lead thy people, to make thyself a glorious name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look down from heaven, and behold from the habitation of thy holiness and of thy glory: where is thy zeal and thy strength, the sounding of thy bowels and of thy mercies toward me? are they restrained?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Doubtless thou art our father, though Abraham be ignorant of us, and Israel acknowledge us not: thou, O Lord, art our father, our redeemer; thy name is from everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, why hast thou made us to err from thy ways, and hardened our heart from thy fear? Return for thy servantsâ€™ sake, the tribes of thine inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of thy holiness have possessed it but a little while: our adversaries have trodden down thy sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are thine: thou never barest rule over them; they were not called by thy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oh that thou wouldest rend the heavens, that thou wouldest come down, that the mountains might flow down at thy presence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As when the melting fire burneth, the fire causeth the waters to boil, to make thy name known to thine adversaries, that the nations may tremble at thy presence!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When thou didst terrible things which we looked not for, thou camest down, the mountains flowed down at thy presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For since the beginning of the world men have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither hath the eye seen, O God, beside thee, what he hath prepared for him that waiteth for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness, those that remember thee in thy ways: behold, thou art wroth; for we have sinned: in those is continuance, and we shall be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we are all as an unclean thing, and all our righteousnesses are as filthy rags; and we all do fade as a leaf; and our iniquities, like the wind, have taken us away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there is none that calleth upon thy name, that stirreth up himself to take hold of thee: for thou hast hid thy face from us, and hast consumed us, because of our iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now, O Lord, thou art our father; we are the clay, and thou our potter; and we all are the work of thy hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not wroth very sore, O Lord, neither remember iniquity for ever: behold, see, we beseech thee, we are all thy people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy holy cities are a wilderness, Zion is a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our holy and our beautiful house, where our fathers praised thee, is burned up with fire: and all our pleasant things are laid waste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wilt thou refrain thyself for these things, O Lord? wilt thou hold thy peace, and afflict us very sore?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am sought of them that asked not for me; I am found of them that sought me not: I said, Behold me, behold me, unto a nation that was not called by my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have spread out my hands all the day unto a rebellious people, which walketh in a way that was not good, after their own thoughts;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A people that provoketh me to anger continually to my face; that sacrificeth in gardens, and burneth incense upon altars of brick;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which remain among the graves, and lodge in the monuments, which eat swineâ€™s flesh, and broth of abominable things is in their vessels;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which say, Stand by thyself, come not near to me; for I am holier than thou. These are a smoke in my nose, a fire that burneth all the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, it is written before me: I will not keep silence, but will recompense, even recompense into their bosom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your iniquities, and the iniquities of your fathers together, saith the Lord, which have burned incense upon the mountains, and blasphemed me upon the hills: therefore will I measure their former work into their bosom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord, As the new wine is found in the cluster, and one saith, Destroy it not; for a blessing is in it: so will I do for my servantsâ€™ sakes, that I may not destroy them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will bring forth a seed out of Jacob, and out of Judah an inheritor of my mountains: and mine elect shall inherit it, and my servants shall dwell there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sharon shall be a fold of flocks, and the valley of Achor a place for the herds to lie down in, for my people that have sought me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye are they that forsake the Lord, that forget my holy mountain, that prepare a table for that troop, and that furnish the drink offering unto that number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore will I number you to the sword, and ye shall all bow down to the slaughter: because when I called, ye did not answer; when I spake, ye did not hear; but did evil before mine eyes, and did choose that wherein I delighted not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus saith the Lord God, Behold, my servants shall eat, but ye shall be hungry: behold, my servants shall drink, but ye shall be thirsty: behold, my servants shall rejoice, but ye shall be ashamed:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, my servants shall sing for joy of heart, but ye shall cry for sorrow of heart, and shall howl for vexation of spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall leave your name for a curse unto my chosen: for the Lord God shall slay thee, and call his servants by another name:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That he who blesseth himself in the earth shall bless himself in the God of truth; and he that sweareth in the earth shall swear by the God of truth; because the former troubles are forgotten, and because they are hid from mine eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, behold, I create new heavens and a new earth: and the former shall not be remembered, nor come into mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But be ye glad and rejoice for ever in that which I create: for, behold, I create Jerusalem a rejoicing, and her people a joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will rejoice in Jerusalem, and joy in my people: and the voice of weeping shall be no more heard in her, nor the voice of crying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be no more thence an infant of days, nor an old man that hath not filled his days: for the child shall die an hundred years old; but the sinner being an hundred years old shall be accursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall build houses, and inhabit them; and they shall plant vineyards, and eat the fruit of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not build, and another inhabit; they shall not plant, and another eat: for as the days of a tree are the days of my people, and mine elect shall long enjoy the work of their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not labour in vain, nor bring forth for trouble; for they are the seed of the blessed of the Lord, and their offspring with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass, that before they call, I will answer; and while they are yet speaking, I will hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wolf and the lamb shall feed together, and the lion shall eat straw like the bullock: and dust shall be the serpentâ€™s meat. They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain, saith the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord, The heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool: where is the house that ye build unto me? and where is the place of my rest?
verses.speaker: Narrator
